shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Daily Office Prayers and Litanies (fols. 3ra-16vb) II) Śǝrʿatä qǝddase “Ordinary of the Mass” (fols. 19ra-37va) III) Anaphoras (fols. 37va-99ra) III-1)Anaphora of the Apostles (fols. 37va-45vb) III-2) Anaphora of Our Lord Jesus Christ (fol. 46rb-vb; 50ra-51vb) preceded by the excerpt (kǝfl) from the "Book of the Testament" (fols. 45vb-46rb) (cp. MQ, IV, Qǝddase ʾǝgziʾ, §§1-17) III-3) Anaphora of St. Cyril of Alexandria (fols. 47ra-49vb; 17ra-18vb; 2ra-va) III-4) Anaphora of Our Lady by St. Cyriacus of Behnesa (fols. 52ra-59ra) III-5) Anaphora of St. John, Son of Thunder (fols. 59ra-66va) III-6) Anaphora of the 318 Orthodox Fathers of Nicaea (fols. 66vb-73ra) III-7) Anaphora of St. Athanasius of Alexandria (fols. 73ra-80va) III-8) Anaphora of St. John Chrysostom (fols. 80ra-84va) III-9) Anaphora of St. Epiphanius of Cyprus (fols. 84vb-89ra) III-10) Anaphora of St. Jacob of Serug (fols. 89ra-93rb) III-11) Anaphora of St. Gregory (“Hosanna-liturgy of St. Gregory”) (fols. 93rb-97ra) III-12) Anaphora of St. Dioscorus of Alexandria (fols. 97ra-99ra)
Additio 1.

dcomments.dcomment: ʾIyasu is mentioned as the reigning king (e.g., fols. 11ra, 15ra). Ṗeṭros is mentioned as the Patriarch and Krǝstodolu as the Metropolitan (fol. 52vb). ʾIyasu II was the King of Ethiopia in 1730-55 and Krǝstodolu III the Metropolitan of Ethiopia in 1720-35. The name of Peter VI (Patriarch of Alexandria in 1718-26) is mentioned in the Ms. for unclear reasons, possibly because the scribe was not informed about his demise.

txstates.txstate: Back cover has a hole close to the outer edge. - Fols. 6, 27 have small holes with loss of text. Fols. 17-18 are misplaced, their proper place should be after fol. 49, but the text in fol. 17 is not an exact continuation from fol. 49 (the text segment በየማኖሙ፡ ለካህናት፡ በ from fol. 49 is repeated in fol. 17); the text in fols. 17-18 is written in a different hand. From fol. 18vb, the text continues on fol. 2ra-va. Fol. 20 is misplaced, its proper place is after fol. 21. Bifolio consisting of fols. 37 and 41 is smaller in size than the other folios. Fols. 50-51 are misplaced, their proper place is between fols. 46 and 47. Fol. 51 has been cut along the outer edge. Holes or tears carefully amended on fols. 1, 23, 48.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, close to the head and the tail of the codex.

squires.squire:
A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – II(8/fols. 11r-18v) – III(3/s. l.: 2, stub after 2/fols. 19r-21v) – IV(2/fols. 22r-23v) – V(3/stub before 1/fols. 24r-26v) – VI(8/fols. 27r-34v) – VII(9/s. l.: 4, stub after 6/fols. 35r-43v) – VIII(6/fols. 44r-49v) – IX(2/fols. 50r-51v) – X(8/fols. 52r-59v) – XI(8/fols. 60r-67v) – XII(8/fols. 68r-75v) – XIII(8/s. l.: 2, stub after 7; 7, stub after 2/fols. 76r-83v) – XIV(8/s. l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 84r-91v) – XV(8/s. l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 92r-99v).
The structure of quire V has been defined tentatively. For misplaced fols., s. State of preservation.

taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are mostly visible (s. fol. 55r). Ruling pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 81r). Structural pricks are mostly visible (s. fols. 24v-25r, 48v-49r). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are mostly visible (s. fol. 55r). Ruling pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 81r). Structural pricks are mostly visible (s. fols. 24v-25r, 48v-49r). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand:
Hand a: fols. 3ra-15va l.12. Hand b: fols. 15va l.13-16rb l.17; 19ra-51vb. Hand c: fols. 2ra-va; 17ra-18vb. Hand d: fols. 16rb l.17-16vb. Hand e: fols. 52ra-99ra.
Hand a: careful; tends to small broad forms of the letters. Hand b: neat, careful, regular, well-trained; slunder letters, tendency to left-sloping shapes; upper elements of some letters (ወ, ጠ, መ, ዋ, ያ etc.) uniformly slanted. Hand c: mediocre. Hand d: mediocre. Hand e: careful, regular, well-trained.

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra; name of the ruling king; incipits of the texts; title of Text I (fol. 3r, upper margin); directives for the ministers; most of the abbreviations; elements of the punctuation signs and Ethiopic numerals.
The text on fol. 3r is written alternately in red and black lines.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ይካ፡ for ይበል፡ ካህን፡ ይዲ፡ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡ ይሕ፡ for ይበል፡ ሕዝብ፡ ቡ፡ for ቡራኬ፡ ጸሎ፡ for ጸሎት፡ በእ፡ for በእንተ፡ (s. fol. 28rb) ና(ስ)፡ ከ(መ)፡ እግ(ዚ)፡ for ናስተበቍዕ፡ ከመ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ (s. fol. 28rb) ቅ፡ ቅ፡ ቅ፡ for ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ (s. fol. 35rb) ሐዳፌ፡ ነ፡ for ሐዳፌ፡ ነፍስ፡ (s. fol. 44ra) ጸሎተ፡ ፈት፡ for ጸሎተ፡ ፈትቶ፡ (s. fol. 65va) ተ(ዘ)፡ ሥ፡ እ፡ ነ፡ እ፡ ድን፡ for ተዘከር፡ ሥጋ፡ እንተ፡ ነሣእከ፡ እምቅድስት፡ ድንግል፡ (s. fol. 72ra) ከ(መ)፡ ው(እ)፡ሥ፡ for ከመ፡ ውእቱ፡ ሥጋ፡ (s. fol. 72ra)

otherdetails.otherdetail: The number of the hands has been defined tentatively; the Ms. could have been written by a greater number of hands. Possibly, the Ms. is composite, but the number and limits of production units are difficult to define.

additional.cont: Fol. 2v: Reader’s note.
additional.det: In Amharic. Probably addressed by a reader of the Ms. to himself.

extras.extra: - Writing exercise (written upside down): fol. 2v - Crude notes: fols. 7v, 8r, 77v, 78r, 84v, 97r.

drawing.info: Fol. 1r: Schematic representation of the Eucharistic bread.
drawing.details: The distribution of the portions among the participants of the Liturgy is not indicated.
